summary: This is a notice of docket activity from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding case 20-2413, United States v. Maxwell. It forwards an order dated September 11, 2020, directing the United States to file a letter brief responding to the appellant's motion to consolidate, directing parties to respond, and adjourning the argument scheduled for September 22, 2020. The document includes a list of attorneys to be electronically notified.

persons.name: Adam Mueller

connections.description: Adam Mueller forwards a court order to Laura Menninger, indicating they are both counsel involved in the same case.
Adam Mueller copies Ty Gee on the email forwarding the court order, indicating they are all part of the legal team or involved parties.
Nicole Simmons forwards a court notification to Adam Mueller, suggesting a professional communication channel, likely from the court or a legal office.
Laura Menninger is listed as counsel to be notified in the case of M. Maxwell (Ghislaine Maxwell), indicating she is part of the defense legal team.

events.title: Second Circuit Issues Order in Maxwell Appeal
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals files an order directing the United States to file a letter brief responding to Appellant's motion to consolidate, directing parties to respond to the Government's letter brief, and adjourning the argument scheduled for September 22, 2020.

events.title: Adjourned Appellate Argument
events.description: The appellate argument originally scheduled for September 22, 2020, in case 20-2413 is adjourned until further order of the Court.

keyFacts: The document is a notice of docket activity from September 11, 2020, for appellate case 20-2413, United States v. Maxwell.
The Second Circuit issued an order directing the U.S. government to file a letter brief in response to the appellant's (Ghislaine Maxwell's) motion to consolidate.
The order adjourned the appellate argument scheduled for September 22, 2020, indicating a delay in the proceedings.
The document lists numerous attorneys, including Laura Menninger and David Boies, who were to receive electronic notification of the court's order, highlighting the extensive legal team involved.
